abstract: The latest financial pundit to unfurl 2007 predictions is David Weidner of MarketWatch, who offers a list of events he expects to see in the next year. A few of them are pretty safe bets: Executive pay will rise, he says; brokerage profits will fall. But his prediction that Wachovia will merge with Wells Fargo — a banking combination that he is not the first to propose — comes with a considerable amount of detail. He writes:
lead_paragraph: The latest financial pundit to unfurl 2007 predictions is David Weidner of MarketWatch, who offers a list of events he expects to see in the next year. A few of them are pretty safe bets: Executive pay will rise, he says; brokerage profits will fall. But his prediction that Wachovia will merge with Wells Fargo — a banking combination that he is not the first to propose — comes with a considerable amount of detail. He writes:

headline.main: Wells Fargo and Wachovia: Is This the Year?
